articles.summary: Moonshot AI released Kimi K2 on Friday. The new model features 1 artificial intelligence (AI) chip. It joins a wave of similar releases from domestic rivals as it seeks to reclaim its position in the competitive local market. It is available in black and white.

articles.title: AI Trends
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Mary Meeker published a 340 page AI Trend report for 2025, May 2025. Meeker frames AI as a 'meta-technology' enabling broader innovations. AI adoption is faster than the internet/mobile eras. Patents in computing/AI are booming. AI chatbots see rising daily/weekly use across ages/groups. Big Tech capex is surging.

articles.title: AI that thinks like us? Researchers unveil new model to predict human behavior
articles.author: Lele Sang
articles.summary: Be.FM is a new AI system developed by researchers at the University of Michigan, Stanford University and MobLab. It is one of the first AI systems designed specifically to predict, simulate and reason about human actions. Be.FM outperformed commercial and open-source models like GPT-4o and Llama in matching human behavior.

articles.title: McDonald's AI Breach Reveals The Dark Side Of Automated Recruitment
articles.author: Tony Bradley
articles.summary: Researchers hacked into McDonald's website and accessed the personal data of millions of job applicants. The breach was caused by the company's AI chatbot, Olivia, which was supposed to handle job applications, collect personal information, and even conduct personality tests. Security experts warn that AI-powered hiring systems should be only as secure as the security controls behind them.

articles.title: The supply chain's last mile is complex and expensive. AI has the potential to fix its woes.
articles.summary: Last-mile delivery is a complex and expensive part of the supply chain. Amazon has been at the forefront of bringing AI into its last mile. Amazon's Wellspring initiative uses generative AI to analyze satellite images, apartment building layouts, street imagery, consumer instructions, and photos from past deliveries. Dispatch uses AI to plan routes based on factors such as traffic. Veho uses AI for quality assurance on its deliveries.

articles.title: Google Discover AI Summaries: Traffic Threat to Publishers?
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Worldwide search traffic has plummeted 15% year-over-year, and the number of news searches ending without a click to a publisher's site has surged to nearly 69%. Google's experiment with AI summaries in Discover presents users with concise overviews of news stories, compiled from multiple sources. Google is also testing other AI-powered features within Discover, such as bullet-point summaries and grouping related news stories. Google launched Offerwall to help publishers generate revenue through alternative methods like micropayments and surveys.

articles.title: AI Promised Faster Coding. This Study Disagrees
articles.author: Billy Perrigo
articles.summary: In the Loop is a twice-weekly newsletter about the world of AI. Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, is in the news today after he said the U.S. government doesn't have to worry about the possibility of the Chinese military using the market-leading AI chips that his company produces.

articles.title: The government wants AI to fight wars and review your taxes
articles.author: Douglas MacMillan
articles.summary: Elon Musk's start-up, xAI, is trying to gain a foothold in federal agencies. The Pentagon is using AI to help officers distinguish between combatants and civilians in the field. The Federal Aviation Administration is exploring whether AI can be a better air traffic controller. The number of personnel using NGA Maven has more than doubled since January.

articles.title: Meta's new AI data center fuels the US water debate
articles.author: Shubhangi Chowdhury
articles.summary: Hyperion data center will be based in Richland Parish, Louisiana. It will have 5 gigawatts of computing power to support Meta's ambitious AI lab. Tech giants are planning to build even more AI data centers across the U.S. AI-powered data centers are putting a serious strain on local water resources.

articles.title: Humans now speak more like ChatGPT, not the other way around, claims study
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: A recent study claims that using ChatGPT as a writing tool has changed how humans communicate with each other. AI detection has become harder as humans have started to speak more like chatGPT instead of the other, according to the study. The research suggests that AI detection is harder because people speak like chatgpt instead of chatp.

articles.title: Mira Murati's Thinking Machines Raises $2B in a16z-Led AI Bet
articles.author: Nirit Abermann
articles.summary: Thinking Machines Lab, founded by Mira Murati, raised $2 billion in a funding round led by Andreessen Horowitz. The startup was launched in February 2025 with no revenue or products. It aims to build safer, more reliable AI systems for broad applications, leveraging a team largely composed of former OpenAI researchers.

articles.title: Laid off Candy Crush studio staff reportedly replaced by the AI tools they helped build
articles.author: Matt Tate
articles.summary: Microsoft's gaming division was hit hard by sweeping layoffs earlier this month. Candy Crush developer King's staff are being replaced by AI tools they worked on. The London-based group working on Farm Heroes Saga is expected to be cut in half. At least five people within Halo Studios were told they no longer had jobs shortly after receiving an all-staff email from Phil Spencer.

articles.title: White House AI czar says US must outcompete China in technology innovation
articles.author: Haisten Willis
articles.summary: David Sacks is the White House AI and crypto czar. He is speaking at a panel discussion titled 'The AI Race and How to Win It' in Pittsburgh. The event is hosted by Sen. David McCormick (R-PA) and will feature President Donald Trump later in the day.

articles.title: Coding has emerged as genAI's killer use case. But what if its benefits are a mirage?
articles.author: Jeremy Kahn
articles.summary: Last week, Google bought Windsurf for $2.4 billion and Cognition bought what was left of the AI startup for an undisclosed sum. METR conducted a randomized control trial involving 16 developers earlier this year to see if using code editor Cursor Pro integrated with Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 3.5 and 3.7 models improved their productivity. When assisted by AI it took the coders 19% longer to finish tasks.

articles.title: AI is helping developers save time, but the struggle to find timely information is costing ...
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is great at helping developers code, but not so useful at helping them with the most common tasks.    - The New York Times.  It's not helpful at helping with common tasks such as programming. It's useful for some tasks but not others.

articles.title: AI can give us a lot and cost us everything
articles.author: Drew Cagle The Murphy Center
articles.summary: In the last couple of years, college professors and primary school teachers across the country have noticed an odd trend. Students who had previously struggled with academic writing are suddenly able to turn in rather pristine essays with flawless grammar and similar phrasing. Many of them view AI as a tool, a technology they can use to work smarter.

articles.title: Mira Murati's AI startup Thinking Machines raises $2 billion in a16z-led round
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Thinking Machines Lab, the artificial intelligence startup founded by Mira Murati, has raised $2 billion in funding. Andreessen Horowitz, Nvidia, Accel, ServiceNow, Cisco, AMD and Jane Street participated in the funding round. Murati started Thinking Machines after an abrupt exit from OpenAI last September.

articles.title: Anthology Unveils Next-Generation AI and Immersive Learning Innovations in Blackboard, Maintains Position as the Fastest-Evolving LMS for the Fourth Year
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Anthology announced a new set of innovations for its award-winning learning management system, Blackboard. It's the fourth consecutive year that Blackboard has been named the fastest-evolving LMS. Anthology is expanding its AI-powered capabilities in Blackboard with the Anthology Virtual Assistant, AVA.

articles.title: 4 Ways Businesses Should Be Using AI Chatbots Now
articles.author: Aytekin Tank
articles.summary: At Jotform, we use AI chatbots to help us serve our customers better. After implementing their customer service-based AI agents, Photobucket has seen a 3% increase in customer satisfaction and a 17% improvement in first resolution times. Businesses no longer have to wait for users to start a conversation and can capture information up front.

articles.title: Survey reveals gap between worker desires and AI's current workplace abilities
articles.author: Shana Lynch
articles.summary: Stanford study shows a gap between worker and AI expert perspectives on what workers want from AI and what is technically feasible. It suggests a shift in the type of work that earns higher wages. Salaries for traditional information analysis will likely dip, while interpersonal skills and emotional intelligence will earn more.

articles.title: 9 AI-Powered Military Rigs Redefining Armored Warfare in 2025
articles.author: Charles Mitchell
articles.summary: The fusion of classic armored vehicles and next-generation AI has sparked a renaissance in the world of defense innovation. The following rundown delves into how AI and cutting-edge engineering are reviving the legends of armored combat. Get ready to learn how these old-school platforms are being revamped for a new generation of war.

articles.title: Meta delivers eye-popping AI announcement
articles.author: Vuk Zdinjak
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg wants to invest billions of dollars in AI. Meta Platforms invested $14.8 billion in Scale AI and acquired a 49% nonvoting stake. Elon Musk's xAI is buying an overseas power plant and shipping it to the U.S. for a data center.

articles.title: Finally, a dev kit for designing on-device, mobile AI apps is here: Liquid AI's LEAP
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Liquid AI has released a cross-platform software development kit (SDK) called LEAP. It makes it easier for developers to integrate small language models (SLMs) directly into mobile applications. The company also introduced Apollo, a companion iOS app for testing these models locally.

articles.title: Future-Proofing Leaders & CX: Soft Skills In An AI World
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: New research uncovers the vital soft skills leaders need to thrive in the AI era and create enhanced customer experiences, according to the research. The research is based on a study by the Centre for Business and Society Research (CBSR). CBSR is a think tank based in New York.

articles.title: XAI Grok 4 is Third on AI Leaderboard
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: XAI Grok 4 ranks third on the LMarena leaderboard ahead of Google Gemini and OpenAI O3. Grok-4 was tested with real-world prompts across domains like coding, math, and creative writing. It also tested with a system prompt from xAI.

articles.title: These 10 U.S. states are best positioned with electricity to power AI data center boom
articles.author: Scott Cohn
articles.summary: Data centers are the backbone of artificial intelligence. Google will spend $25 billion to develop data centers along the nation's largest multi-state grid. CoreWeave announced a $6 billion AI data center project in Pennsylvania. CNBC considers each state's electrical grid in its annual competitiveness study, America's Top States for Business.

articles.title: AI coding tools are shifting to a surprising place: The terminal
articles.author: Russell Brandom
articles.summary: Terminal-based AI systems are interacting directly with the shell of the system they're installed in. Anthropic, DeepMind, and OpenAI have all released command-line coding tools since February. Cursor, Windsurf, and GitHub's Copilot have been the standard for AI-powered software development for years. New research suggests programmers overestimate productivity gains from conventional tools.

articles.title: AI coding tools are shifting to a surprising place: the terminal
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: For years, code-editing tools like Cursor, Windsurf and GitHub's Copilot have been the standard for AI-powered software development. Anthropic, DeepMind and OpenAI have all released command-line coding tools since February. Some believe the future of AI will be when 95% of computer interaction is through a terminal.

articles.title: QuantLase Lab's new tech innovations at the fore, set to redefine Quantum Photonics.
articles.summary: QuantLase Lab is a research and innovation powerhouse based in Abu Dhabi. It is directed by quantum seeker Dr. Pramod Kumar. He explores how advanced quantum optics and photonic intelligence are shaping the future of sustainable computation and AI. The world is increasingly reliant on high-speed computation and artificial intelligence.

articles.title: White House AI czar says US must outcompete China in technology innovation
articles.author: Haisten Willis
articles.summary: David Sacks is the White House AI and crypto czar. He is speaking at a panel discussion titled 'The AI Race and How to Win It' in Pittsburgh. The event is hosted by Sen. David McCormick (R-PA) and will feature President Donald Trump later in the day. Sacks, McCormick, Mubadala CEO Khaldoon Al-Mubarak and Blackstone CEO Jon Gray are discussing the future of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Meta AI: Closed Models & Superintelligence Risks
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Meta is considering changing its AI development strategy to a closed-source model. The social media giant is considering closing its 'Behemoth' AI in favor of a proprietary system. It's part of a trend towards greater caution and strategic positioning in the AI landscape. The future of artificial intelligence could be fundamentally reshaped by data quality.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg says AI researchers want 2 things apart from money
articles.summary: Big Tech companies and artificial intelligence startups are courting AI researchers. Meta has hired AI researchers from Google, Anthropic, and OpenAI. Mark Zuckerberg has also been hired by Meta recently. The company has turbocharged its plans to build out its AI infrastructure.

articles.title: AI Impact Awards 2025: Financial Services Need Efficient, Reliable Solutions
articles.author: Lauren Giella
articles.summary: Principal Financial Group created PAIGE, an AI-powered assistant that automates content generation, training materials and marketing content through advanced analytics. ABBYY is the winner of Newsweek's AI Impact Award for Best Outcomes for its work helping Asia-Pacific vehicle part part Bapcorco with its advanced Document AI.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg says AI researchers want 2 things apart from money
articles.author: Sarah Jackson
articles.summary: Zuckerberg has been personally involved in recruiting top AI talent. Big Tech companies and startups are clamoring for the best talent in AI. Mark Zuckerberg says two factors besides pay help attract top AI researchers when recruiting. Meta is in the midst of a massive AI hiring spree to build its Superintelligence Labs. It spent $15 billion to hire Scale founder Alexandr Wang and announced plans for a data center nearly the size of Manhattan.

articles.title: New method makes AI language model evaluations faster, fairer, and less costly
articles.author: Andrew Myers
articles.summary: Stanford researchers have developed a new way to evaluate new AI language models. The new approach is faster, fairer, and less expensive. It uses a question generator that can be fine-tuned to the desired level of difficulty. It was presented at the International Conference on Machine Learning.

articles.title: Barclays Downgrades Sun Life Financial (SLF) Stock to Underweight
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: Sun Life Financial Inc. (NYSE:SLF) is one of the Best Large Cap Value Stocks to Invest In. Barclays analyst Alex Scott downgraded the company's stock to 'Underweight' from 'Equal Weight' with a price objective of C$82. The firm expects growing risk in Medicaid dental for the company. Morningstar highlighted that Sun Life Financial remains one of Big 3 Canadian life insurers that collectively make up 80% of the nation's life insurance premiums.

articles.title: UBS Upgraded Corebridge Financial (CRBG) Stock to Neutral
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: Corebridge Financial, Inc. (NYSE:CRBG) is one of the Best Large Cap Value Stocks to Invest In. UBS upgraded the company's stock to 'Neutral' from 'Sell' with a price objective of $37, up from the prior target of $28. The firm sees the shares as fairly valued after the variable annuity reinsurance deal with Venerable.

articles.title: Corporate Enabling Functions Have High Hopes For AI, But Few Have A Strategy In Place
articles.author: Laura Clayton McDonnell
articles.summary: It's been two-and-a-half years since Generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) made its public debut. Professionals in enabling functions like corporate tax, trade, legal, and risk and compliance see AI as an essential tool for handling the complex challenges they face daily. Most corporate legal departments have invested in new AI tools in the past 12 months, compared to only 40% of law firms. Only 19% of respondents reported having a formal AI strategy in place to support ongoing AI-related innovation across their departments.

articles.title: Rota SBDC wraps up exclusive AI training for small business owners
articles.summary: The Rota Small Business Development Center at Northern Marianas College hosted an in-person AI training on Thursday, July 10, 2025, at the NMC Rota Campus. It is the Rota SBDC's official AI session for Calendar Year 2025 and supports the CNMI SBDC Network initiative to integrate AI adoption into small business development across the region.

articles.title: Trump to Tout Billions in Investments to Create AI Hub in Pennsylvania
articles.author: Amrith Ramkumar
articles.summary: Google, Blackstone and CoreWeave pledge billions of dollars to invest in the development of artificial intelligence in Pennsylvania. President Trump is expected to praise the investments in the state. Google will put $25 billion into data centers needed to train AI models and related infrastructure in Pennsylvania and the surrounding region.

articles.title: Samsung looking at Ai earnings
articles.summary: There's a big push to develop new types of artificial intelligence-powered consumer electronics. Samsung is looking into wearable devices potentially including earrings and necklaces. The company envisions a new wave of Ai devices that allow users to communicate and get things done without having to take out a phone.

articles.title: 9-Year-Old Visual Novel Runs Just Fine But Apple Is Booting It From The App Store Anyway
articles.author: Kotaku
articles.summary: Wheels of Aurelia is a visual novel about a young woman on a road trip in 1970s Italy and the people she meets along the way. It's about to get delisted from the App Store. Developer Santa Ragione says Apple is doing that because it's cultural and artistic products.

articles.title: Terror laws watchdog warns of risk posed by extremists using AI
articles.author: Belfast Telegraph
articles.summary: Terrorists will use artificial intelligence (AI) to promote their products.      Â   in order to do so, they will use AI to help them in their propaganda.  in which they will target people using AI to do this.

articles.title: Genius at Work: Elon Musk's Grok Launches Goth Anime Girl AI ‘Companion'
articles.author: Lucas Nolan
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot platform Grok has launched a new feature offering AI companions to paid subscribers. Two AI companions are currently available: 'Ani,' a goth anime girl with blonde pigtails wearing a tight corset, short black dress and thigh-high fishnets, and 'Bad Rudy,' a 3D animated fox creature.

articles.title: Most believe AI helps small businesses compete with larger firms
articles.author: Joseph Staples
articles.summary: According to the poll of 1,000 American business owners, marketers, and salespeople, 77% believe the more they use AI tools for work, the more confident they feel in the quality of their work. 75% believe using AI for their business can make it more effective at competing with larger and more well-known businesses. In a typical week, people said using AI at work saved them 13 hours of time and $4,739 in operational costs.

articles.title: $10 Million Round For Agentic Engineer Led By Former Google CEO's Venture Firm
articles.author: Charlie Fink
articles.summary: Berkeley-based IntuigenceAI is emerging from stealth this week with $10 million in seed funding. The AI agents digitize the technical blueprints and other specialized and specific data that runs factories, plants and refineries. They are already in pilot use at several major corporations, including in the energy and industrial manufacturing sectors.

articles.title: GitLab started at Buy by Rosenblatt on AI tailwinds, upsell potential
articles.author: Pratyush Thakur
articles.summary: Rosenblatt started coverage of GitLab with a Buy rating and a $58 price target. The firm expects GitLab to generate $939 million in revenue in fiscal 2026, up 24% year-on-year, and non-GAAP earnings of $0.75 per share.

articles.title: Ghost Tumor & Misdiagnosis: A 79-Year-Old's Case
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: AI and advanced imaging are revolutionizing the diagnosis of atypical lung tumours. The future of ghost tumor diagnosis is about predicting risk and proactively managing underlying conditions. AI algorithms are trained on vast datasets of chest X-rays and CT scans and can identify subtle patterns indicative of a ghost tumor even before clinical symptoms fully manifest.

articles.title: 28 pct of businesses in Israel use AI: survey
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: Survey conducted by Israel's Central Bureau of Statistics shows that 28 percent of businesses in the country are using artificial intelligence (AI) in their operations. It is the first such survey to be conducted in Israel's history.      .

articles.title: YouTube Will Not Monetize Content Featuring AI-Generated Videos from July 15, 2025
articles.author: Donna Hancock
articles.summary: The rise of generative AI tools has made it easier than ever to create convincing videos with minimal human input. This has led to a flood of low-quality, misleading, or entirely fabricated content. YouTube's updated guidelines define AI-generated videos as content where the primary visuals or audio are created by artificial intelligence with little to no human involvement.

articles.title: Pentagon taps four commercial tech firms to expand military use of AI
articles.author: Courtney Albon
articles.summary: The Pentagon has chosen Google, xAI, Anthropic and OpenAI to help the U.S. military expand its use of advanced artificial intelligence capabilities. Each company received a contract worth up to $200 million. The firms will help the Defense Department develop agentic AI workflows for key national security missions.

articles.title: Candy Crush developers replaced by the AI they made
articles.author: Game Central
articles.summary: Candy Crush Saga developer King was one of the first studios to report layoffs earlier in the month. Around 200 staff are believed to have been cut at King. Farm Heroes Saga, made in the UK, has lost half of its staff, including level designers and user research.

articles.title: Research Unit Proposes Human-Machine Cooperation To Drive Safety
articles.author: Chen Chuanren
articles.summary: The International Centre for Aviation Innovation (ICAI) is calling for a shift from traditional human-centric automation to a human-machine hybrid cooperation model. ICAI will speak at the Asia Pacific Aviation Summit on July 15th.    iaccai.org.

articles.title: IntuigenceAI unveils world's first superintelligent AI engineer, raises $10M to solve labor shortage crisis
articles.author: Daniel Levi
articles.summary: Berkeley-based AI startup, IntuigenceAI, has just launched its first artificial intelligence-based engineer. The company has raised $10 million in seed funding to develop its product. IntuigeAI's synthetic engineers achieved an 81% pass rate on the NCEES Professional Engineering exam for chemical and mechanical disciplines. The platform is built around the Intelligent Board, an AI workspace where engineers can upload schematics, equipment manuals, and live telemetry data from industrial systems. It breaks the problem into parts, runs analysis through its trained agents, and offers recommendations.

articles.title: Mistral releases Voxtral, its first open source AI audio model
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan
articles.summary: Mistral has released Voxtral, its first open-source audio model aimed at businesses. It can transcribe and understand languages including English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Hindi, German, Dutch, and Italian. Mistral is in talks to raise up to $1 billion in equity from investors like Abu Dhabi's MGX fund.

articles.title: Bloomberg Tax & Accounting Unveils Enhanced AI Assistant Features
articles.author: Bloomberg Tax
articles.summary: Bloomberg Tax & Accounting has announced a significant upgrade to its AI capabilities, unveiling advanced features for its AI Assistant. This innovative chat-based research tool is designed to streamline and speed up tax and accounting research, making the process more efficient and user-friendly.

articles.title: WP Engine Launches AI Toolkit Empowering Website Owners to Drive Engagement and Growth
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: WP Engine's new AI toolkit was designed to integrate seamlessly with WordPress websites. It features Smart Search AI, AI-Powered Recommendations, and Managed Vector Database with an open-source chatbot framework. It was launched at DEODE 2025, the company's annual conference.

articles.title: One of the Best Alexa+ Features Has Been Delayed
articles.author: Joe Fedewa
articles.summary: Alexa+ is a new version of Alexa that has been infused with generative AI. It's free for Prime subscribers but costs $15 per month or $139 per year for non-Prime subscribers. The web interface was supposed to launch by the end of June, but the new target is no sooner than July 31.

articles.title: AI malware could beat Microsoft Defender up to 8 percent of the time
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: Hackers will present a new AI-powered malware that can defeat Microsoft Defender up to 8 percent of the time. The system is built on an open-source language model and trained on data for $1,500 over three months. It could access one in every 10 of the 1.4 billion active Windows machines in the world.

articles.title: Google to Invest $25 Billion in AI Data Centers in US
articles.author: Sean Burch
articles.summary: Google will invest $25 billion in artificial intelligence infrastructure and data centers in the United States over the next two years. The company will also be putting $3 billion towards updating two hydropower plants in Pennsylvania that will serve the AI data centers. Google also announced a new 'AI Works for America' program, where it will train workers on how to use the new technology.

articles.title: Elon Musk's chatbot Grok searches for his views before answering questions
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: Elon Musk's new AI chatbot, Grok 4, is echoing the views of its billionaire creator, so much so that it will sometimes search online for Musk's stance on an issue before offering up an opinion. The unusual behavior of the chatbot has surprised some experts.

articles.title: AI content crackdown: YouTube's loss, other platforms' gain?
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: The battle against low-quality AI is a battle against AI that is not very good at AI. It's a struggle against AI with poor quality AI.   Â     “I am not satisfied with the quality of AI.”

articles.title: Terror laws watchdog warns of risk posed by extremists using AI
articles.author: David Hughes
articles.summary: Jonathan Hall KC warned that terrorists will use artificial intelligence to promote their ideologies and plan atrocities. He suggested new laws to ban the creation or possession of computer programmes designed to stir up racial or religious hatred. Jaswant Singh Chail climbed into the grounds of Windsor Castle in 2021 armed with a crossbow after conversing with a chatbot called Sarai about planning the attack.

articles.title: Amazon gives $100M boost to AWS Generative AI Innovation Center, betting on agentic AI
articles.author: Todd Bishop
articles.summary: Amazon is investing another $100 million in its AWS Generative AI Innovation Center. The center pairs AWS customers with Amazon engineers, data scientists, and strategists to develop practical AI solutions. It has worked with organizations including BMW, Formula 1, Warner Bros. Discovery, AstraZeneca, the PGA Tour, Yahoo Finance, and others.

articles.title: AMD stock soars 8% as new AI chips take aim at Nvidia's throne — is a power shift coming?
articles.summary: HSBC upgraded AMD stock to 'Buy' and raised its price target from $100 to $200. The Instinct MI350 series of AI chips could directly challenge Nvidia's Blackwell lineup, while costing roughly 30% less. Key customers include Oracle, Microsoft, Meta, and OpenAI. AMD's next big leap is the MI400 series, scheduled to launch in 2026, with 432 GB of HBM4 memory. The stock broke out of a flag pattern and is moving in a bullish trend.

articles.title: Milesight Propels Vision AI Transformation by Announcing a New Brand CamThink, Expanding Edge AI-driven Innovations to Industries and Communities
articles.author: Milesight
articles.summary: Milesight, a leading innovator in intelligent IoT products, announces the official launch of the CamThink brand dedicated to accelerating real-world AI adoption with edge intelligence. CamThink provides vision AI cameras, edge AI computing devices and a series of open architecture hardware.

articles.title: 3 Reasons SoundHound AI Stock Could Explode Higher
articles.author: Bradley Guichard
articles.summary: There is a huge market opportunity in conversational intelligence. SoundHound AI (NASDAQ: SOUN) is winning customers and growing revenue rapidly. The company reports a 151% year-over-year increase in sales in the first quarter of 2025, hitting $29 million. It also finished with $246 million in cash and no long-term debt. The stock price is down while revenue is soaring.

articles.title: Fulcrum Announces Strategic Vision for Agentic AI to Redefine the Future of Fieldwork
articles.author: Fulcrum
articles.summary: New roadmap introduces intelligent, hands-free operations powered by Agentic AI, setting a new standard for AI-powered operations. It's based on the new roadmap introduced by the company's new CEO, Tim Berners-Lee, which is based on AI technology.

articles.title: Haut.AI Launches the SPF Truth Booth: See Your Future Skin - With and Without Sunscreen
articles.author: Haut.AI
articles.summary: The SPF Truth Booth is the first-ever Gen AI-powered sunscreen effectiveness test visualizes long-term UV damage. It's in celebration of UV Safety Awareness Month. It simulates how the user's skin could age over time – with and without daily sunscreen protection.

articles.title: AI as fact-checkers
articles.author: Virtual Jerusalem
articles.summary: What are the implications of using AI chatbots to fact check breaking news? Read more Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera here.   .       in Al Jazeera's news section.  in this article.

articles.title: Developers claim to have trained AI replacements while layoffs are increasing
articles.summary: Candy Crush maker King has announced significant job cuts. Around 200 employees have been laid off, with many more facing uncertainty as union negotiations continue into September. King was recently acquired by Microsoft through its Activision Blizzard deal. Staff members are concerned about AI-powered tools being used to eliminate positions. Microsoft announced 9,000 job cuts earlier this year, impacting Xbox and other video game divisions.

articles.title: How AI chatbots are helping hackers target your banking accounts
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: AI chatbots are becoming the primary way people interact with the internet. Hackers are exploiting these chatbots to carry out AI phishing attacks. When people use AI tools to search for login pages for banking and tech platforms, the tools return incorrect links and can be used to steal personal information.

articles.title: Looking to AI for a financial plan? Take it more as guidance than gospel, experts say
articles.author: Ritika Dubey
articles.summary: AI chatbots are finding a place in managing everyday money. Martin Dasko uses ChatGPT to set up savings plans for upcoming vacations. Expert Katelyn Aitcheson advises people to have a solid sense of their finances before using AI chatbots. Check Point's cybersecurity evangelist Jane Arnett warns it's not always safe to ask AI questions that contain sensitive information.

articles.title: RSNA: AI Tool Accurately Detects Tumor Location on Breast MRI
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: An AI model trained to detect abnormalities on breast MR images outperformed benchmark models when tested in three different groups. The study was published today in Radiology, a journal of the Radiological Society of North America. Anomaly detection models distinguish between normal and abnormal data, flagging the anomalies, or abnormalities for further investigation.

articles.title: AI Might Now Be as Good as Humans at Detecting Emotion, Political Leaning, and Sarcasm
articles.author: Ana Jovančević
articles.summary: Latent content analysis is concerned with uncovering the deeper meanings, sentiments, and subtleties embedded in text. This type of analysis can help us grasp political leanings present in communications. New study tested whether conversational AI can read between the lines of human-written texts. GPT-4 is about as good as humans at analyzing sentiment, political leaning, emotional intensity, and sarcasm detection.

articles.title: Zoom's AI Features Streamline Workflows for Busy Professionals
articles.summary: Zoom is evolving into a smart digital assistant aiming to streamline your entire workday, not just your meetings. New AI-powered features are being rolled out at no additional cost for existing paid users. Custom AI Companion add-on democratizes the powerful capabilities.
